c74object.name: hirt.convolutionreverb~
c74object.digest: The HIRT Convolution Reverb for Max
c74object.description: Including realtime EQ, Modulation and Virtual Positioning, as well as offline Frequency Dependent Damping and Shape Controls (IR trimming, reversal and direct sound handling control). Additionally, the Early and Late parts of the reverb may be taken from different Impulse Responses (by using Split Mode). This allows for a richer and more flexible control over the virtual space. IR selection from the HIRT set of IRs can be done using the menus, although IRs may also be dropped onto the waveform space. The abstraction is a good example of advanced use of the HIRT externals collection.

inlet.description: Left Audio Signal to be reverberated / Messages to hirt.convolutionreverb~
Right Audio Signal to be reverberated / Messages to hirt.convolutionreverb~

outlet.digest: Multiple messages, corresponding to the various input and attribute messages above
outlet.description: A direct feed from the dumpout of the internal pattrstorage object. Any internal parameter can be queried and returned here, as well as current state and storage data.

objarg.name: reverbname
objarg.digest: Set the name of this instance of the reverb
objarg.description:
Setting the name is optional. If set, the name will be displayed in the reverb User Interface. Setting the name enables remote control of any internal parameter of hirt.convolutionreverb~ using messages to Max.
The name is also given to the globalpatchername attribute of the abstraction enabling targeting by custom pattr systems. (For addressing multiple instances simultaneously one can use the special global namespace hirt.convolutionreverb).
Remote control can only address reverb parameters, not the internal pattrstorage (for pattrstorage targeting use inlets).

method.name: anything
method.description: The abstraction also accepts any message to pattrstorage for setting, querying and dealing with storage options. All pattrstorage messages can be used, and all attributes can be used apart from greedy, notifymode & parameter_enable.

method.name: close
method.description: The symbol close (or wclose) will cause the currently open UI editor window to close.

method.name: iradd
method.description:
The symbol iradd alone causes a file browser window to open for selecting a new impulse response file for loading into the convolution section. Slot A or B will be populated depending on current state (see the irmode message).
Adding an IR with this message is identical to drag & drop in the interface or using the file attribute.
Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

method.name: irfolder
method.digest: Address folder menu by integer index
method.description:
Syntax: irfolder <int: index>
The IR library is arranged into folders in the HIRT Package. The IR menu below it shows items in the selected folder. If a sample is dropped onto the wave display (or using iradd), the folder where that sample came from is added to the bottom of this folder menu. With the irfolder message one can address the menu items in the folder menu by zero-indexed integer.
The current state of the menu can only be infered from the user interface, but the initial items will always be constant (the factory folders).
See also the file, fileA & fileB attributes.

method.name: irmenu
method.digest: Address IR menu by integer index
method.description:
Syntax: irmenu <int: index>
Select an IR from the list in the current folder. With the irmenu message one can address the menu items in the IR menu by zero-indexed integer.
The current state of the menu can be infered from the user interface, but for the factory content these are constants.
See also the file, fileA & fileB attributes.

method.name: irmode
method.digest: Select single or dual IR bahaviour
method.description:
Syntax: irmode <int: flag>
Allows switching between using 'Single' (0) for quick auditioning between A / B Impulse Responses (IRs), and using one IR for the early reflections and another for the late reflections (1).
In Split (1) mode, A is used for the closer early part of the sound, while B is used for the long tail.

method.name: open
method.description: The symbol open (or front) will cause the UI editor window to open.

method.name: signal
method.digest: In either inlet: The Audio signals to be reverberated
method.description: In the Left inlet: The Left signal to be reverberated. In the Right inlet: The Right signal to be reverberated.

attribute.name: amount
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of modulation in percent.

attribute.name: cascade
attribute.description: The amount of early reflections to be sent into the late reflections (or vice versa when the IR is reversed). A setting of 0 percent is the original IR. Increasing the value can make the reverb sound bigger or better blend the early and late reflections in split mode.

attribute.name: damp
attribute.description: Offline. Turn Damp section on or off. (De)activating will affect the loaded IR(s) depending on the settings in this section.

attribute.name: dampdecay1
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Low Dampening. Negative gains sound more natural. Positive gains are used to increase the decay of certain frequencies for example to add sizzle or clarity in the highs.

attribute.name: dampdecay2
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Mid Dampening. Negative gains sound more natural. Positive gains are used to increase the decay of certain frequencies for example to add sizzle or clarity in the highs.

attribute.name: dampdecay3
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the High Dampening. Negative gains sound more natural. Positive gains are used to increase the decay of certain frequencies for example to add sizzle or clarity in the highs.

attribute.name: dampfreq1
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the center frequency of the Low Frequency Dampening.

attribute.name: dampfreq2
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the center frequency of the Peak Frequency Dampening.

attribute.name: dampfreq3
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the center frequency of the High Frequency Dampening.

attribute.name: dampq2
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the Bandwidth of the Peak Dampening. Has a pronounced effect on the dampening. Moderate settings sound more natural. Extremely high values create filter sweeps.

attribute.name: dampslope1
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the Slope of the Low Frequency Dampening. Has a pronounced effect on the dampening. Moderate settings sound more natural. Extremely high values create filter sweeps.

attribute.name: dampslope3
attribute.description: Offline. Adjusts the Slope of the High Frequency Dampening. Has a pronounced effect on the dampening. Moderate settings sound more natural. Extremely high values create filter sweeps.

attribute.name: decay
attribute.description: Offline. Internally generates a new IR with an envelope to increase or decrease the decay time in percent. This can be used for example to create a room out of a hall or to extend the length of the tail.

attribute.name: depth
attribute.description: Simulates repositioning of the source closer or further away in the room. This is essentially a balance between the Early and Late reflections with some delay compensation.

attribute.name: direct
attribute.description:
Offline. Sets the direct mode.
'Remove Direct' (0) removes both onset and any detected direct sound from the start of an IR.
'Remove Onset' (1) removes only the onset (leaving any detected direct sound).
'No Auto Trim' (2) loads the IR exactly as in the loaded file, without any trimming.

attribute.name: drywet
attribute.description: Adjusts the balance between the input signal (dry) and the processed signal (wet). Set this to 100 percent when the reverb is used like a return track insert.

attribute.name: early
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the percentage of the early reflections to use. The default is 100 percent (no alteration). Smaller values trim the start of the IR accordingly.

attribute.name: eq
attribute.description:
EQ Off/On - Choose EQ Off/On in DSP chain.
OFF (0) - no EQ, also CPU disables this section.
ON (1) - EQ pre early convolution signal.

attribute.name: eqfreq1
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Lowshelf filter.

attribute.name: eqfreq2
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Bell filter.

attribute.name: eqfreq3
attribute.description: Sets the center frequency of the Highshelf filter.

attribute.name: eqgain1
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Lowshelf filter. Rolling-off low frequencies can prevent muddy reverb.

attribute.name: eqgain2
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Bell Filter.

attribute.name: eqgain3
attribute.description: Adjusts the amount of boost or attenuation of the Highshelf filter. Adjusting the Highshelf gain can make the reverb brighter or duller.

attribute.name: eqq2
attribute.description: Adjusts the Bandwidth of the Bell filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: eqslope1
attribute.description: Adjusts the Slope of the Lowshelf filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: eqslope3
attribute.description: Adjusts the Resonance of the Highshelf filter. Moderate to lower settings sound more natural.

attribute.name: fadein
attribute.description: Offline. Applies a fade in of the specified length to the start of the IR.

attribute.name: fadeout
attribute.description: Offline. Applies a fade out of the specified length to the end of the IR. When shortening an IR using the length control, the fade out control can be used to adjust the abruptness of the effect.

attribute.name: file
attribute.digest: Load IR File to current slot
attribute.description: Load a new IR file by file name (if file present in your search path) or by file path/name (if file outside your search path). With this attribute, the requested file with be loaded into whichever A/B slot is currently chosen. For specific slot loading see the fileA & fileB attributes. Must be a symbol, so use "quotes" if there are spaces. Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Load IR File to current slot

attribute.name: fileA
attribute.digest: Load IR File to slot A
attribute.description: Load a new IR file into slot A by file name (if file present in your search path) or by file path/name (if file outside your search path). file1 may also be used. Must be a symbol, so use "quotes" if there are spaces. file & fileB attributes are also available. Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Load IR File to slot A

attribute.name: fileB
attribute.digest: Load IR File to slot B
attribute.description: Load a new IR file into slot B by file name (if file present in your search path) or by file path/name (if file outside your search path). file2 may also be used. Must be a symbol, so use "quotes" if there are spaces. file & fileA attributes are also available. Note: when adding a set of stereo or true stereo IRs, only one of the associated files need be added - other files will be parsed automatically.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Load IR File to slot B

attribute.name: gain
attribute.description: Adjust the output volume of the wet portion of the mix.

attribute.name: irmode
attribute.description:
Allows switching between using 'Single' (0) for quick auditioning between A / B Impulse Responses (IRs), and using one IR for the early reflections and another for the late reflections (1).
In Split (1) mode, A is used for the closer early part of the sound, while B is used for the long tail.

attribute.name: lengthmode
attribute.description: Set the Shape Length dial mode. 0 sets dial in percent, 1 sets dial in time (ms). These are two separate dials and can have different settings, switching them affects the IR.

attribute.name: lengthpercent
attribute.digest: Set the length of the IR
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the length of the IR to use. This can be used to shorten the IR to simulate a gated reverb effect, or for other special effects.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Set the length of the IR

attribute.name: lengthtime
attribute.digest: Set the length of the IR
attribute.description: Offline. Sets the length of the IR to use. This can be used to shorten the IR to simulate a gated reverb effect, or for other special effects.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Set the length of the IR

attribute.name: modtype
attribute.description: In 'Mode I' (0) the modulation is applied to the Input before the reverberation and is more natural and subtle. In 'Mode II' (1) the modulation is applied to the wet Output for a stronger and more algorithmic or chorus sound.

attribute.name: modulation
attribute.description: Turn Modulation section on or off. Also (de)activates CPU usage for this section. Also accepts the attribute as the shortened "mod".

attribute.name: modwidth
attribute.description: In 'Normal' mode (0) the modulation is applied exactly the same to both sides of the stereo signal. In 'Wide' mode (1), the Left and Right phases are inverted from each other to create a greater stereo separation.

attribute.name: pan
attribute.description: Adjusts the simulated position of the source in panorama. With True Stereo IRs, the signal will retain some left and right as your ears would hear it. With mono or stereo IRs, panning will remove output on the opposite side.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Turn Position section on or off. Also (de)activates CPU usage for this section. Also accepts the attribute as the shortened "pos".

attribute.name: predelay
attribute.digest: Pre early reflection delay time onset
attribute.description: Controls the delay time, in milliseconds, before the onset of the first early reflection. One's impression of the distance from any walls, e.g. the size of a room, depends partially on this delay. Typical values for natural sounds range from 1ms to 25ms.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Pre early reflection delay time onset

attribute.name: rate
attribute.description: Adjusts the rate (in Hz) of the semi random modulation.

attribute.name: reverse
attribute.description: Offline. 0 is normal, 1 reverses the IR. The IR Display is updated accordingly.

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description: Offline. Turn Shape section on or off. (De)activating will affect the loaded IR(s) depending on the settings in this section.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Offline. Internally generates a new IR by resampling. Larger sizes have a longer time and darker sound. Smaller sizes become brighter, shorter and more focused.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Adjusts the stereo width of the Wet signal. With 0 percent, the wet signal is mono. With 100 percent the original image is preserved. Wet signals with wider images stand out in a mix more. Wet signals with narrower images blend into a mix more.

c74object.discussion: Based on the original Ableton 'Convolution Reverb Pro' device programmed by Alex Harker. 2018 MSP port by Pete Dowling. To explore the abstraction either right-click an instantiated abstraction and choose "Object > Open Original...", or open the original '.maxpat' from the Max Browser. After this, cmnd/ctrl-e to go into edit mode, then cmnd/ctrl-click the "View" button.
